intro: Crinum × augustum, commonly known as the hybrid lily or golden crinum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, supporting large, showy flowers in shades of white, yellow, and pink. The plant features strap-like, narrow leaves that are often blue-green in color, and it produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers. Crinum × augustum is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
